newsitem.title: USA: AutoImmune says will cut staff.
newsitem.headline: AutoImmune says will cut staff.

text.p: AutoImmune Inc (Nasdaq: AIMM) said Thursday it is cutting its staff from 74 to 51 full-time employees.
The company said this move reflects the previously announced disappointing preliminary results of the myloral phase III trial. All the jobs the company is cutting relate to the myloral program.
The company said it will redirect its resources toward the clinical development of colloral, its product for rheumatoid arthritis.
The company said it expects to report the collaral phase III data in May, and plans to begin the trial later this year.
The company reported a a net loss of $7.6 million, or $0.47 per share, for the quarter compared with a net loss of $4.1 million, or $0.25 per share, for the same quarter one year earlier.
The company said its increase it research and development expenses to $7.5 million from $4.3 million reflect the its spending for two products in late stage trials.
AutoImmune Inc is a biopharmaceutical company developing drug therapies for the treatment of autoimmune diseases.
